intro: Helipterum loganianum, commonly known as the yellow everlasting, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces bright yellow ray flowers surrounded by pale yellow disk flowers, creating a striking visual display. It is often found in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. Helipterum loganianum is also valued for its ornamental use in gardens and its ability to thrive in coastal regions.
